meanings.def: a comfortable or suitable role, job, way of life, etc.
examples: He eventually found his niche in sports journalism.
He had found his own little niche in life.
She's carved out quite a niche for herself in fashion design.
women who dared question their niche in society

meanings.def: a small section of the market for a particular kind of product or service
examples: They spotted a niche in the market, with no serious competition.
There's a niche for a small stylish car.

meanings.def: a small hollow place, especially in a wall to contain a statue, etc., or in the side of a hill
examples: The niche was just big enough to hold two small candles.
I found a niche in the rock and sat and watched while the sun rose and filled the valley with light.

meanings.def: a position or role taken by a kind of living thing within its community. Different living things may have the same niche in different places, for example antelopes in Africa and kangaroos in Australia.
examples: Within each niche, similar animals avoid competing with each other.
Mammals moved into the niche left vacant by the disappearance of the dinosaurs.

meanings.def: appealing to only a small section of the population
examples: Enthusiast markets will always exist but they are niche.
We see niche products as one of our strengths.
the development of niche marketing (= aiming products at particular groups)
a film intended for a niche audience
